CVE-2015-0202.title: USN-2721-1: Subversion vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-0202.body: Evgeny Kotkov discovered that the Subversion mod_dav_svn module incorrectly handled large numbers of REPORT requests. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause the server to crash, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 15.04. (CVE-2015-0202)

CVE-2015-0220.title: USN-2469-1: Django vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-0220.body: Mikko Ohtamaa discovered that Django incorrectly handled user-supplied redirect URLs. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to perform a cross-site scripting attack. (CVE-2015-0220)

CVE-2015-0221.title: USN-2469-1: Django vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-0221.body: Alex Gaynor discovered that Django incorrectly handled reading files in django.views.static.serve(). A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause Django to consume resources, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2015-0221)

CVE-2015-0228.title: USN-2523-1: Apache HTTP Server vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-0228.body: Guido Vranken discovered that the mod_lua module incorrectly handled a specially crafted websocket PING in certain circumstances. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause the server to stop responding, leading to a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.10. (CVE-2015-0228)

CVE-2015-0236.title: USN-2867-1: libvirt vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-0236.body: Luyao Huang discovered that libvirt incorrectly handled VNC passwords in shapshot and image files. A remote authenticated user could use this issue to possibly obtain VNC passwords. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS. (CVE-2015-0236)

CVE-2015-0239.title: USN-2518-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-0239.body: A flaw was discovered in the Kernel Virtual Machine's (KVM) emulation of the SYSTENTER instruction when the guest OS does not initialize the SYSENTER MSRs. A guest OS user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service of the guest OS (crash) or potentially gain privileges on the guest OS. (CVE-2015-0239)

CVE-2015-0239.title: USN-2515-1: Linux kernel (Trusty HWE) vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-0239.body: A flaw was discovered in the Kernel Virtual Machine's (KVM) emulation of the SYSTENTER instruction when the guest OS does not initialize the SYSENTER MSRs. A guest OS user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service of the guest OS (crash) or potentially gain privileges on the guest OS. (CVE-2015-0239)

CVE-2015-0239.title: USN-2516-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities

A guest OS user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service of the guest OS (crash) or potentially gain privileges on the guest OS. (CVE-2015-0239)

A guest OS user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service of the guest OS (crash) or potentially gain privileges on the guest OS. (CVE-2015-0239)

A guest OS user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service of the guest OS (crash) or potentially gain privileges on the guest OS. (CVE-2015-0239)

CVE-2015-0247.title: USN-2507-1: e2fsprogs vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-0247.body: Jose Duart discovered that e2fsprogs incorrectly handled invalid block group descriptor data. A local attacker could use this issue with a crafted filesystem image to possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-0247, CVE-2015-1572)

CVE-2015-0248.title: USN-2721-1: Subversion vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-0248.body: Evgeny Kotkov discovered that the Subversion mod_dav_svn and svnserve modules incorrectly certain crafted parameter combinations. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause the server to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2015-0248)

CVE-2015-0255.title: USN-2500-1: X.Org X server vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-0255.body: Olivier Fourdan discovered that the X.Org X server incorrectly handled XkbSetGeometry requests resulting in an information leak. An attacker able to connect to an X server, either locally or remotely, could use this issue to possibly obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2015-0255)

CVE-2015-0261.title: USN-2580-1: tcpdump vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-0261.body: It was discovered that tcpdump incorrectly handled printing certain packets. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause tcpdump to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. In the default installation, attackers would be isolated by the tcpdump AppArmor profile.

CVE-2015-0272.title: USN-2792-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-0272.body: It was discovered that the Linux kernel did not check if a new IPv6 MTU set by a user space application was valid. A remote attacker could forge a route advertisement with an invalid MTU that a user space daemon like NetworkManager would honor and apply to the kernel, causing a denial of service. (CVE-2015-0272)

CVE-2015-0292.title: USN-2537-1: OpenSSL vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-0292.body: Robert Dugal and David Ramos discovered that OpenSSL incorrectly handled decoding Base64 encoded data. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause OpenSSL to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-0292)

CVE-2015-0293.title: USN-2537-1: OpenSSL vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-0293.body: Sean Burford and Emilia Käsper discovered that OpenSSL incorrectly handled specially crafted SSLv2 CLIENT-MASTER-KEY messages. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause OpenSSL to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2015-0293)

CVE-2015-0295.title: USN-2626-1: Qt vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-0295.body: Fabian Vogt discovered that Qt incorrectly handled certain malformed BMP images. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted BMP image, a remote attacker could use this issue to cause Qt to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2015-0295)

CVE-2015-0799.title: USN-2557-1: Firefox vulnerability
CVE-2015-0799.body: Muneaki Nishimura discovered a flaw in Mozilla's HTTP Alternative Services implementation which meant SSL certificate verification could be bypassed in some circumstances. A remote attacker could potentially exploit this to conduct a man in the middle attack. (CVE-2015-0799)

CVE-2015-0801.title: USN-2552-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-0801.body: Olli Pettay and Boris Zbarsky discovered an issue during anchor navigations in some circumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted message with scripting enabled, an attacker could potentially exploit this to bypass same-origin policy restrictions. (CVE-2015-0801)

CVE-2015-0801.title: USN-2550-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-0801.body: Olli Pettay and Boris Zbarsky discovered an issue during anchor navigations in some circumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to bypass same-origin policy restrictions. (CVE-2015-0801)

CVE-2015-0802.title: USN-2550-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-0802.body: Bobby Holley discovered that windows created to hold privileged UI content retained access to privileged internal methods if navigated to unprivileged content. An attacker could potentially exploit this in combination with another flaw, in order to execute arbitrary script in a privileged context. (CVE-2015-0802)

CVE-2015-0803.title: USN-2550-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-0803.body: Several type confusion issues were discovered in Firefox. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2015-0803, CVE-2015-0804)

CVE-2015-0804.title: USN-2550-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-0804.body: Several type confusion issues were discovered in Firefox. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2015-0803, CVE-2015-0804)

CVE-2015-0807.title: USN-2552-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-0807.body: Christoph Kerschbaumer discovered that CORS requests from navigator.sendBeacon() followed 30x redirections after preflight. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted message with scripting enabled, an attacker could potentially exploit this to conduct cross-site request forgery (XSRF) attacks. (CVE-2015-0807)

CVE-2015-0807.title: USN-2550-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-0807.body: Christoph Kerschbaumer discovered that CORS requests from navigator.sendBeacon() followed 30x redirections after preflight. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to conduct cross-site request forgery (XSRF) attacks. (CVE-2015-0807)

CVE-2015-0811.title: USN-2550-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-0811.body: Felix Gröbert discovered an out-of-bounds read in the QCMS colour management library. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2015-0811)

CVE-2015-0816.title: USN-2552-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-0816.body: Mariusz Mlynski discovered that documents loaded via resource: URLs (such as PDF.js) could load privileged chrome pages. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted message with scripting enabled, an attacker could potentially exploit this in combination with another flaw, in order to execute arbitrary script in a privileged context. (CVE-2015-0816)

CVE-2015-0816.title: USN-2550-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-0816.body: Mariusz Mlynski discovered that documents loaded via resource: URLs (such as PDF.js) could load privileged chrome pages. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this in combination with another flaw, in order to execute arbitrary script in a privileged context. (CVE-2015-0816)

CVE-2015-0818.title: USN-2538-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-0818.body: Mariusz Mlynski discovered a flaw in the processing of SVG format content navigation. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could exploit this to run arbitrary script in a privileged context. (CVE-2015-0818)

CVE-2015-0821.title: USN-2505-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-0821.body: Armin Razmdjou discovered that opening hyperlinks with specific mouse and key combinations could allow a Chrome privileged URL to be opened without context restrictions being preserved. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to bypass security restrictions. (CVE-2015-0821)

CVE-2015-0822.title: USN-2505-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-0822.body: Armin Razmdjou discovered that contents of locally readable files could be made available via manipulation of form autocomplete in some circumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2015-0822)

CVE-2015-0824.body: Atte Kettunen discovered a crash when drawing images using Cairo in some circumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2015-0824)

CVE-2015-0825.title: USN-2505-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-0825.body: Atte Kettunen discovered a buffer underflow during playback of MP3 files in some circumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2015-0825)

CVE-2015-0826.body: Atte Kettunen discovered a buffer overflow during CSS restyling in some circumstances. CVE-2015-0827.body: Abhishek Arya discovered an out-of-bounds read and write when rendering SVG content in some circumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2015-0827)

If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox. CVE-2015-0830.title: USN-2505-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-0830.body: Daniele Di Proietto discovered that WebGL could cause a crash in some circumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2015-0830)

CVE-2015-0834.title: USN-2505-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-0834.body: Alexander Kolesnik discovered that Firefox would attempt plaintext connections to servers when handling turns: and stuns: URIs. A remote attacker could potentially exploit this by conducting a Man-in-the-middle (MITM) attack in order to obtain credentials. (CVE-2015-0834)

CVE-2015-0848.title: USN-2670-1: libwmf vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-0848.body: Fernando Muñoz and Stefan Cornelius discovered that libwmf incorrectly handled certain malformed images. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a crafted image file, an attacker could cause a denial of service or execute arbitrary code with privileges of the user invoking the program.

CVE-2015-0860.title: USN-2820-1: dpkg vulnerability
CVE-2015-0860.body: Hanno Boeck discovered that the dpkg-deb tool incorrectly handled certain old style Debian binary packages. If a user or an automated system were tricked into unpacking a specially crafted binary package, a remote attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code.

CVE-2015-1071.title: USN-2937-1: WebKitGTK+ vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1071.body: A large number of security issues were discovered in the WebKitGTK+ Web and JavaScript engines. If a user were tricked into viewing a malicious website, a remote attacker could exploit a variety of issues related to web browser security, including cross-site scripting attacks, denial of service attacks, and arbitrary code execution.

CVE-2015-1159.title: USN-2629-1: CUPS vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1159.body: It was discovered that the CUPS templating engine contained a cross-site scripting issue. A remote attacker could use this issue to bypass default configuration settings. (CVE-2015-1159)

CVE-2015-1209.title: USN-2495-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1209.body: A use-after-free bug was discovered in the DOM implementation in Blink. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via renderer crash or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the sandboxed render process. (CVE-2015-1209)

CVE-2015-1213.title: USN-2521-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1213.body: Several out-of-bounds write bugs were discovered in Skia. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service via application crash or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking the program. (CVE-2015-1213, CVE-2015-1214, CVE-2015-1215)

CVE-2015-1219.body: An integer overflow was discovered in Skia. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking the program. (CVE-2015-1219)

CVE-2015-1227.title: USN-2521-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1227.body: It was discovered that Blink did not initialize memory for image drawing in some circumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to read uninitialized memory. (CVE-2015-1227)

CVE-2015-1228.title: USN-2521-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1228.body: It was discovered that Blink did not initialize memory for a data structure in some circumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via renderer crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the sandboxed render process. (CVE-2015-1228)

CVE-2015-1235.title: USN-2570-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1235.body: An issue was discovered in the HTML parser in Blink. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to bypass same-origin restrictions. (CVE-2015-1235)

CVE-2015-1236.title: USN-2570-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1236.body: An issue was discovered in the Web Audio API implementation in Blink. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to bypass same-origin restrictions. (CVE-2015-1236)

CVE-2015-1240.title: USN-2570-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1240.body: An out-of-bounds read was discovered in the WebGL implementation. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via renderer crash. (CVE-2015-1240)

CVE-2015-1241.title: USN-2570-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1241.body: An issue was discovered with the interaction of page navigation and touch event handling. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to conduct "tap jacking" attacks. (CVE-2015-1241)

CVE-2015-1244.title: USN-2570-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1244.body: It was discovered that websocket connections were not upgraded whenever a HSTS policy is active. A remote attacker could potentially exploit this to conduct a man in the middle (MITM) attack. (CVE-2015-1244)

CVE-2015-1246.title: USN-2570-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1246.body: An out-of-bounds read was discovered in Blink. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via renderer crash. (CVE-2015-1246)

CVE-2015-1283.title: USN-2726-1: Expat vulnerability
CVE-2015-1283.body: It was discovered that Expat incorrectly handled malformed XML data. If a user or application linked against Expat were tricked into opening a crafted XML file, an attacker could cause a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

CVE-2015-1303.title: USN-2757-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1303.body: Two security issues were discovered in Blink and V8. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit these to bypass same-origin restrictions. (CVE-2015-1303, CVE-2015-1304)

CVE-2015-1315.title: USN-2502-1: unzip vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1315.body: William Robinet discovered that unzip incorrectly handled certain malformed zip archives. If a user or automated system were tricked into processing a specially crafted zip archive, an attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code.

CVE-2015-1318.title: USN-2569-1: Apport vulnerability
CVE-2015-1318.body: Stéphane Graber and Tavis Ormandy independently discovered that Apport incorrectly handled the crash reporting feature. A local attacker could use this issue to gain elevated privileges.

CVE-2015-1319.title: USN-2741-1: Unity Settings Daemon vulnerability
CVE-2015-1319.body: It was discovered that the Unity Settings Daemon incorrectly allowed removable media to be mounted when the screen is locked. If a vulnerability were discovered in some other desktop component, such as an image library, a local attacker could possibly use this issue to gain access to the session.

CVE-2015-1322.title: USN-2581-1: NetworkManager vulnerability
CVE-2015-1322.body: Tavis Ormandy discovered that NetworkManager incorrectly filtered paths when requested to read modem device contexts. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to bypass privileges and manipulate modem device configuration or read arbitrary files.

CVE-2015-1323.title: USN-2648-1: Aptdaemon vulnerability
CVE-2015-1323.body: Tavis Ormandy discovered that Aptdeamon incorrectly handled the simulate dbus method. A local attacker could use this issue to possibly expose sensitive information, or perform other file access as the root user.

CVE-2015-1324.title: USN-2609-1: Apport vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1324.body: Sander Bos discovered that Apport incorrectly handled permissions when the system was configured to generate core dumps for setuid binaries. A local attacker could use this issue to gain elevated privileges. (CVE-2015-1324)

CVE-2015-1329.title: USN-2677-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1329.body: A use-after-free was discovered in oxide::qt::URLRequestDelegatedJob in some circumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking the program. (CVE-2015-1329)

CVE-2015-1330.title: USN-2657-1: unattended-upgrades vulnerability
CVE-2015-1330.body: It was discovered that unattended-upgrades incorrectly performed authentication checks in certain configurations. If a remote attacker were able to perform a man-in-the-middle attack, this flaw could potentially be used to install altered packages.

CVE-2015-1332.title: USN-2735-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1332.body: A heap corruption issue was discovered in oxide::JavaScriptDialogManager. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking the program. (CVE-2015-1332)

CVE-2015-1333.body: Colin King discovered a flaw in the add_key function of the Linux kernel's keyring subsystem. A local user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (memory exhaustion). (CVE-2015-1333)

CVE-2015-1337.title: USN-2746-1: Simple Streams vulnerability
CVE-2015-1337.body: It was discovered that Simple Streams did not properly perform gpg verification in some situations. A remote attacker could use this to perform a man-in-the-middle attack and inject malicious content into the stream.

CVE-2015-1337.title: USN-2746-2: Simple Streams regression
CVE-2015-1337.body: USN-2746-1 fixed a vulnerability in Simple Streams. The update caused a regression preventing MAAS from downloading PXE images. This update fixes the problem. We apologize for the inconvenience. Original advisory details: It was discovered that Simple Streams did not properly perform gpg verification in some situations. A remote attacker could use this to perform a man-in-the-middle attack and inject malicious content into the stream.

CVE-2015-1342.title: USN-2813-1: LXCFS vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1342.body: It was discovered that LXCFS incorrectly enforced directory escapes. A local attacker could use this issue to possibly escalate privileges. (CVE-2015-1342)

CVE-2015-1344.title: USN-2813-1: LXCFS vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1344.body: It was discovered that LXCFS incorrectly checked certain permissions. A local attacker could use this issue t possibly escalate privileges. (CVE-2015-1344)

CVE-2015-1349.title: USN-2503-1: Bind vulnerability
CVE-2015-1349.body: Jan-Piet Mens discovered that Bind incorrectly handled Trust Anchor Management. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause bind to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

CVE-2015-1395.title: USN-2651-1: GNU patch vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1395.body: Jakub Wilk discovered that GNU patch did not correctly handle file renames in git style patch files. An attacker could specially craft a patch file that could overwrite arbitrary files with the privileges of the user invoking the program. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 14.10. (CVE-2015-1395)

CVE-2015-1396.title: USN-2651-1: GNU patch vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1396.body: Jakub Wilk discovered the fix for CVE-2015-1196 was incomplete for GNU patch. An attacker could specially craft a patch file that could overwrite arbitrary files with the privileges of the user invoking the program. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 14.10. (CVE-2015-1396)

CVE-2015-1472.title: USN-2519-1: GNU C Library vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1472.body: Joseph Myers discovered that the GNU C Library wscanf function incorrectly handled memory. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause the GNU C Library to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. This issue only affected Ubuntu 12.04 LTS, Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 14.10. (CVE-2015-1472, CVE-2015-1473)

CVE-2015-1473.title: USN-2519-1: GNU C Library vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1473.body: Joseph Myers discovered that the GNU C Library wscanf function incorrectly handled memory. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause the GNU C Library to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. This issue only affected Ubuntu 12.04 LTS, Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 14.10. (CVE-2015-1472, CVE-2015-1473)

CVE-2015-1572.title: USN-2507-1: e2fsprogs vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1572.body: Jose Duart discovered that e2fsprogs incorrectly handled invalid block group descriptor data. A local attacker could use this issue with a crafted filesystem image to possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-0247, CVE-2015-1572)

CVE-2015-1593.title: USN-2565-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1593.body: An integer overflow was discovered in the stack randomization feature of the Linux kernel on 64 bit platforms. A local attacker could exploit this flaw to bypass the Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR) protection mechanism. (CVE-2015-1593)

CVE-2015-1593.title: USN-2564-1: Linux kernel (Utopic HWE) vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1593.body: An integer overflow was discovered in the stack randomization feature of the Linux kernel on 64 bit platforms. A local attacker could exploit this flaw to bypass the Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR) protection mechanism. (CVE-2015-1593)

CVE-2015-1593.title: USN-2563-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1593.body: An integer overflow was discovered in the stack randomization feature of the Linux kernel on 64 bit platforms. A local attacker could exploit this flaw to bypass the Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR) protection mechanism. (CVE-2015-1593)

CVE-2015-1593.title: USN-2562-1: Linux kernel (Trusty HWE) vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1593.body: An integer overflow was discovered in the stack randomization feature of the Linux kernel on 64 bit platforms. A local attacker could exploit this flaw to bypass the Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR) protection mechanism. (CVE-2015-1593)

CVE-2015-1593.title: USN-2561-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1593.body: An integer overflow was discovered in the stack randomization feature of the Linux kernel on 64 bit platforms. A local attacker could exploit this flaw to bypass the Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR) protection mechanism. (CVE-2015-1593)

CVE-2015-1593.body: An integer overflow was discovered in the stack randomization feature of the Linux kernel on 64 bit platforms. A local attacker could exploit this flaw to bypass the Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR) protection mechanism. (CVE-2015-1593)

CVE-2015-1607.title: USN-2554-1: GnuPG vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1607.body: Hanno Böck discovered that GnuPG incorrectly handled certain malformed keyrings. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a malformed keyring, a remote attacker could use this issue to cause GnuPG to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-1606, CVE-2015-1607)

CVE-2015-1774.title: USN-2578-1: LibreOffice vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1774.body: It was discovered that LibreOffice incorrectly handled certain HWP files. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted HWP document, a remote attacker could cause LibreOffice to crash, and possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-1774)

CVE-2015-1781.title: USN-2985-2: GNU C Library regression
CVE-2015-1781.body: Arjun Shankar discovered that in certain situations the nss_dns code in the GNU C Library did not properly account buffer sizes when passed an unaligned buffer. An attacker could use this to cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-1781)

CVE-2015-1781.title: USN-2985-1: GNU C Library vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1781.body: Arjun Shankar discovered that in certain situations the nss_dns code in the GNU C Library did not properly account buffer sizes when passed an unaligned buffer. An attacker could use this to cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-1781)

CVE-2015-1788.title: USN-2639-1: OpenSSL vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1788.body: Joseph Barr-Pixton discovered that OpenSSL incorrectly handled malformed ECParameters structures. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause OpenSSL to hang, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2015-1788)

CVE-2015-1789.title: USN-2639-1: OpenSSL vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1789.body: Robert Swiecki and Hanno Böck discovered that OpenSSL incorrectly handled certain ASN1_TIME strings. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause OpenSSL to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2015-1789)

CVE-2015-1792.title: USN-2639-1: OpenSSL vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1792.body: Johannes Bauer discovered that OpenSSL incorrectly handled verifying signedData messages using the CMS code. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause OpenSSL to hang, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2015-1792)

CVE-2015-1794.title: USN-2830-1: OpenSSL vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1794.body: Guy Leaver discovered that OpenSSL incorrectly handled a ServerKeyExchange for an anonymous DH ciphersuite with the value of p set to 0. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause OpenSSL to crash, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only applied to Ubuntu 15.10. (CVE-2015-1794)

CVE-2015-1802.title: USN-2536-1: libXfont vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1802.body: Ilja van Sprundel, Alan Coopersmith, and William Robinet discovered that libXfont incorrectly handled malformed bdf fonts. A local attacker could use this issue to cause libXfont to crash, or possibly execute arbitrary code in order to gain privileges.

CVE-2015-1804.title: USN-2536-1: libXfont vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1804.body: Ilja van Sprundel, Alan Coopersmith, and William Robinet discovered that libXfont incorrectly handled malformed bdf fonts. A local attacker could use this issue to cause libXfont to crash, or possibly execute arbitrary code in order to gain privileges.

CVE-2015-1819.title: USN-2812-1: libxml2 vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1819.body: Florian Weimer discovered that libxml2 incorrectly handled certain XML data. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted document, an attacker could possibly cause resource consumption, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 12.04 LTS, Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 15.04. (CVE-2015-1819)

CVE-2015-1851.title: USN-2703-1: Cinder vulnerability
CVE-2015-1851.body: Bastian Blank discovered that Cinder guessed image formats based on untrusted data. An attacker could use this to read arbitrary files from the Cinder host.

CVE-2015-1856.title: USN-2704-1: Swift vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1856.body: Clay Gerrard discovered Swift allowed users to delete the latest version of object regardless of object permissions when allow_version is configured. An attacker could use this issue to delete objects. (CVE-2015-1856)

CVE-2015-1858.title: USN-2626-1: Qt vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1858.body: Richard Moore and Fabian Vogt discovered that Qt incorrectly handled certain malformed BMP images. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted BMP image, a remote attacker could use this issue to cause Qt to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-1858)

CVE-2015-1859.title: USN-2626-1: Qt vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1859.body: Richard Moore and Fabian Vogt discovered that Qt incorrectly handled certain malformed ICO images. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted ICO image, a remote attacker could use this issue to cause Qt to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-1859)

CVE-2015-1860.title: USN-2626-1: Qt vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1860.body: Richard Moore and Fabian Vogt discovered that Qt incorrectly handled certain malformed GIF images. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted GIF image, a remote attacker could use this issue to cause Qt to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-1860)

CVE-2015-1863.title: USN-2577-1: wpa_supplicant vulnerability
CVE-2015-1863.body: It was discovered that wpa_supplicant incorrectly handled SSID information when creating or updating P2P peer entries. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause wpa_supplicant to crash, resulting in a denial of service, expose memory contents, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

CVE-2015-1872.title: USN-2944-1: Libav vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-1872.body: It was discovered that Libav incorrectly handled certain malformed media files. If a user were tricked into opening a crafted media file, an attacker could cause a denial of service via application crash, or possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking the program.

CVE-2015-2059.title: USN-3068-1: Libidn vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-2059.body: Thijs Alkemade, Gustavo Grieco, Daniel Stenberg, and Nikos Mavrogiannopoulos discovered that Libidn incorrectly handled invalid UTF-8 characters. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause Libidn to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly disclose sensitive memory. This issue only applied to Ubuntu 12.04 LTS and Ubuntu 14.04 LTS. (CVE-2015-2059)

CVE-2015-2150.title: USN-2632-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-2150.body: Jan Beulich discovered the Xen virtual machine subsystem of the Linux kernel did not properly restrict access to PCI command registers. A local guest user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (host crash). (CVE-2015-2150)

CVE-2015-2150.title: USN-2631-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-2150.body: Jan Beulich discovered the Xen virtual machine subsystem of the Linux kernel did not properly restrict access to PCI command registers. A local guest user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (host crash). (CVE-2015-2150)

CVE-2015-2153.title: USN-2580-1: tcpdump vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-2153.body: It was discovered that tcpdump incorrectly handled printing certain packets. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause tcpdump to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. In the default installation, attackers would be isolated by the tcpdump AppArmor profile.

CVE-2015-2304.title: USN-2549-1: libarchive vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-2304.body: It was discovered that the libarchive bsdcpio utility extracted absolute paths by default without using the --insecure flag, contrary to expectations. If a user or automated system were tricked into extracting cpio archives containing absolute paths, a remote attacker may be able to write to arbitrary files. (CVE-2015-2304)

CVE-2015-2305.body: It was discovered that PHP incorrectly handled regular expressions. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-2305)

CVE-2015-2316.title: USN-2539-1: Django vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-2316.body: Andrey Babak discovered that Django incorrectly handled strip_tags. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause Django to enter an infinite loop, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 14.10. (CVE-2015-2316)

CVE-2015-2317.title: USN-2539-1: Django vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-2317.body: Daniel Chatfield discovered that Django incorrectly handled user-supplied redirect URLs. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to perform a cross-site scripting attack. (CVE-2015-2317)

CVE-2015-2348.title: USN-2572-1: PHP vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-2348.body: Paulos Yibelo discovered that PHP incorrectly handled moving files when a pathname contained a null character. A remote attacker could use this issue to possibly bypass filename restrictions. This issue only applied to Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 14.10. (CVE-2015-2348)

CVE-2015-2668.title: USN-2594-1: ClamAV vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-2668.body: It was discovered that ClamAV incorrectly handled certain malformed files. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause ClamAV to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. CVE-2015-2694.title: USN-2810-1: Kerberos vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-2694.body: It was discovered that the Kerberos kdcpreauth modules incorrectly tracked certain client requests. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to bypass intended preauthentication requirements. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 15.04. (CVE-2015-2694)

CVE-2015-2697.title: USN-2810-1: Kerberos vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-2697.body: It was discovered that Kerberos incorrectly handled certain TGS requests. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2015-2697)

CVE-2015-2698.title: USN-2810-1: Kerberos vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-2698.body: It was discovered that Kerberos incorrectly handled certain IAKERB packets. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2015-2696, CVE-2015-2698)

CVE-2015-2710.title: USN-2603-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-2710.body: Atte Kettunen discovered a buffer overflow during the rendering of SVG content with certain CSS properties in some circumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted message with scripting enabled, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Thunderbird. (CVE-2015-2710)

CVE-2015-2718.title: USN-2602-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-2718.body: Mark Hammond discovered that when a trusted page is hosted within an iframe in an untrusted page, the untrusted page can intercept webchannel responses meant for the trusted page in some circumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could exploit this to bypass origin restrictions. (CVE-2015-2718)

CVE-2015-2721.title: USN-2673-1: Thunderbird vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-2721.body: Karthikeyan Bhargavan discovered that NSS incorrectly handled state transitions for the TLS state machine. If a remote attacker were able to perform a man-in-the-middle attack, this flaw could be exploited to skip the ServerKeyExchange message and remove the forward-secrecy property. (CVE-2015-2721)

(CVE-2015-2734, CVE-2015-2735, CVE-2015-2736, CVE-2015-2737, CVE-2015-2738, CVE-2015-2739, CVE-2015-2740)

If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website in a browsing context, an attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Thunderbird. (CVE-2015-2734, CVE-2015-2735, CVE-2015-2736, CVE-2015-2737, CVE-2015-2738, CVE-2015-2739, CVE-2015-2740)

CVE-2015-2741.title: USN-2656-2: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-2741.body: David Keeler discovered that key pinning checks can be skipped when an overridable certificate error occurs. This allows a user to manually override an error for a fake certificate, but cannot be exploited on its own. (CVE-2015-2741)

CVE-2015-2741.title: USN-2656-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-2741.body: David Keeler discovered that key pinning checks can be skipped when an overridable certificate error occurs. This allows a user to manually override an error for a fake certificate, but cannot be exploited on its own. (CVE-2015-2741)

CVE-2015-2756.title: USN-2608-1: QEMU vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-2756.body: Jan Beulich discovered that QEMU, when used with Xen, didn't properly restrict access to PCI command registers. A malicious guest could use this issue to cause a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 14.10. (CVE-2015-2756)

CVE-2015-2775.title: USN-2558-1: Mailman vulnerability
CVE-2015-2775.body: It was discovered that Mailman incorrectly handled special characters in list names. A local attacker could use this issue to perform a path traversal attack and execute arbitrary code as the Mailman user.

CVE-2015-2783.title: USN-2572-1: PHP vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-2783.body: It was discovered that PHP incorrectly handled unserializing PHAR files. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause PHP to possibly expose sensitive information. (CVE-2015-2783)

CVE-2015-2806.title: USN-2559-1: Libtasn1 vulnerability
CVE-2015-2806.body: Hanno Böck discovered that Libtasn1 incorrectly handled certain ASN.1 data. A remote attacker could possibly exploit this with specially crafted ASN.1 data and cause applications using Libtasn1 to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

CVE-2015-2830.title: USN-2631-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-2830.body: A privilege escalation was discovered in the fork syscall via the int80 entry on 64 bit kernels with 32 bit emulation support. An unprivileged local attacker could exploit this flaw to increase their privileges on the system. (CVE-2015-2830)

CVE-2015-2830.title: USN-2632-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-2830.body: A privilege escalation was discovered in the fork syscall via the int80 entry on 64 bit kernels with 32 bit emulation support. An unprivileged local attacker could exploit this flaw to increase their privileges on the system. (CVE-2015-2830)

CVE-2015-3143.title: USN-2591-1: curl vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-3143.body: Paras Sethia discovered that curl could incorrectly re-use NTLM HTTP credentials when subsequently connecting to the same host over HTTP. (CVE-2015-3143)

CVE-2015-3144.title: USN-2591-1: curl vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-3144.body: Hanno Böck discovered that curl incorrectly handled zero-length host names. If a user or automated system were tricked into using a specially crafted host name, an attacker could possibly use this issue to cause curl to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.10 and Ubuntu 15.04. (CVE-2015-3144)

CVE-2015-3145.title: USN-2591-1: curl vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-3145.body: Hanno Böck discovered that curl incorrectly handled cookie path elements. If a user or automated system were tricked into parsing a specially crafted cookie, an attacker could possibly use this issue to cause curl to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS, Ubuntu 14.10 and Ubuntu 15.04. (CVE-2015-3145)

CVE-2015-3153.title: USN-2591-1: curl vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-3153.body: Yehezkel Horowitz and Oren Souroujon discovered that curl sent HTTP headers both to servers and proxies by default, contrary to expectations. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.10 and Ubuntu 15.04. (CVE-2015-3153)

CVE-2015-3166.title: USN-2621-1: PostgreSQL vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-3166.body: Noah Misch discovered that PostgreSQL incorrectly handled certain standard library function return values, possibly leading to security issues. (CVE-2015-3166)

CVE-2015-3167.title: USN-2621-1: PostgreSQL vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-3167.body: Noah Misch discovered that the pgcrypto function could return different error messages when decrypting using an incorrect key, possibly leading to a security issue. (CVE-2015-3167)

CVE-2015-3183.title: USN-2686-1: Apache HTTP Server vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-3183.body: It was discovered that the Apache HTTP Server incorrectly parsed chunk headers. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to perform HTTP request smuggling attacks. (CVE-2015-3183)

CVE-2015-3184.title: USN-2721-1: Subversion vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-3184.body: C. Michael Pilato discovered that the Subversion mod_dav_svn module incorrectly restricted anonymous access. A remote attacker could use this issue to read hidden files via the path name. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 15.04. (CVE-2015-3184)

CVE-2015-3185.title: USN-2686-1: Apache HTTP Server vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-3185.body: It was discovered that the Apache HTTP Server incorrectly handled the ap_some_auth_required API. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to bypass intended access restrictions. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 15.04. (CVE-2015-3185)

CVE-2015-3187.title: USN-2721-1: Subversion vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-3187.body: C. Michael Pilato discovered that Subversion incorrectly handled path-based authorization. A remote attacker could use this issue to obtain sensitive path information. (CVE-2015-3187)

CVE-2015-3193.title: USN-2830-1: OpenSSL vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-3193.body: Hanno Böck discovered that the OpenSSL Montgomery squaring procedure algorithm may produce incorrect results when being used on x86_64. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to break encryption. This issue only applied to Ubuntu 15.10. (CVE-2015-3193)

CVE-2015-3195.title: USN-2830-1: OpenSSL vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-3195.body: Adam Langley discovered that OpenSSL incorrectly handled malformed X509_ATTRIBUTE structures. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause OpenSSL to consume resources, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2015-3195)

CVE-2015-3202.title: USN-2617-3: NTFS-3G vulnerability
CVE-2015-3202.body: USN-2617-1 fixed a vulnerability in NTFS-3G. The original patch did not completely address the issue. This update fixes the problem. Original advisory details: Tavis Ormandy discovered that FUSE incorrectly filtered environment variables. A local attacker could use this issue to gain administrative privileges.

CVE-2015-3202.title: USN-2617-1: FUSE vulnerability
CVE-2015-3202.body: Tavis Ormandy discovered that FUSE incorrectly filtered environment variables. A local attacker could use this issue to gain administrative privileges.

CVE-2015-3202.title: USN-2617-2: NTFS-3G vulnerability
CVE-2015-3202.body: USN-2617-1 fixed a vulnerability in FUSE. This update provides the corresponding fix for the embedded FUSE copy in NTFS-3G. Original advisory details: Tavis Ormandy discovered that FUSE incorrectly filtered environment variables. A local attacker could use this issue to gain administrative privileges.

CVE-2015-3209.title: USN-2630-1: QEMU vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-3209.body: Matt Tait discovered that QEMU incorrectly handled the virtual PCNET driver. A malicious guest could use this issue to cause a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code on the host as the user running the QEMU process. In the default installation, when QEMU is used with libvirt, attackers would be isolated by the libvirt AppArmor profile. (CVE-2015-3209)

CVE-2015-3223.title: USN-2855-2: Samba regression
CVE-2015-3223.body: Thilo Uttendorfer discovered that the Samba LDAP server incorrectly handled certain packets. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause the LDAP server to stop responding, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS, Ubuntu 15.04 and Ubuntu 15.10. (CVE-2015-3223)

CVE-2015-3223.title: USN-2855-1: Samba vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-3223.body: Thilo Uttendorfer discovered that the Samba LDAP server incorrectly handled certain packets. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause the LDAP server to stop responding, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS, Ubuntu 15.04 and Ubuntu 15.10. (CVE-2015-3223)

CVE-2015-3223.title: USN-2856-1: ldb vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-3223.body: Thilo Uttendorfer discovered that the ldb incorrectly handled certain zero values. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause applications using ldb, such as Samba, to stop responding, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2015-3223)

CVE-2015-3228.title: USN-2697-1: Ghostscript vulnerability
CVE-2015-3228.body: William Robinet and Stefan Cornelius discovered that Ghostscript did not correctly handle certain Postscript files. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted file, an attacker could cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code.

CVE-2015-3238.title: USN-2935-3: PAM regression
CVE-2015-3238.body: Sebastien Macke discovered that the PAM pam_unix module incorrectly handled large passwords. A local attacker could possibly use this issue in certain environments to enumerate usernames or cause a denial of service. (CVE-2015-3238)

CVE-2015-3247.body: Frediano Ziglio discovered that Spice incorrectly handled monitor configs. In the default installation, when QEMU is used with libvirt, attackers would be isolated by the libvirt AppArmor profile.

CVE-2015-3258.title: USN-2659-1: cups-filters vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-3258.body: Petr Sklenar discovered that the cups-filters texttopdf filter incorrectly handled line sizes. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code as the lp user. (CVE-2015-3258, CVE-2015-3279)

CVE-2015-3279.title: USN-2659-1: cups-filters vulnerabilities

CVE-2015-3281.title: USN-2668-1: HAProxy vulnerability
CVE-2015-3281.body: It was discovered that HAProxy incorrectly handled certain buffers. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to obtain sensitive information belonging to previous requests.

CVE-2015-3290.body: Andy Lutomirski discovered a flaw in the Linux kernel's handling of nested NMIs (non-maskable interrupts). An unprivileged local user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash) or potentially escalate their privileges. (CVE-2015-3290)

CVE-2015-3310.body: It was discovered that ppp incorrectly handled large PIDs. When pppd is used with a RADIUS server, a remote attacker could use this issue to cause it to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

CVE-2015-3329.title: USN-2572-1: PHP vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-3329.body: It was discovered that PHP incorrectly handled opening tar, zip or phar archives through the PHAR extension. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-3329)

CVE-2015-3330.title: USN-2572-1: PHP vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-3330.body: It was discovered that PHP incorrectly handled cleanup when used with Apache 2.4. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-3330)

CVE-2015-3331.title: USN-2631-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-3331.body: A memory corruption issue was discovered in AES decryption when using the Intel AES-NI accelerated code path. A remote attacker could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash) or potentially escalate privileges on Intel base machines with AEC-GCM mode IPSec security association. (CVE-2015-3331)

CVE-2015-3395.body: It was discovered that Libav incorrectly handled certain malformed media files. If a user were tricked into opening a crafted media file, an attacker could cause a denial of service via application crash, or possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking the program.

CVE-2015-3414.title: USN-2698-1: SQLite vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-3414.body: Michal Zalewski discovered that SQLite incorrectly handled dequoting of collation-sequence names. An attacker could use this issue to cause applications using SQLite to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 15.04. (CVE-2015-3414)

CVE-2015-3415.title: USN-2698-1: SQLite vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-3415.body: Michal Zalewski discovered that SQLite incorrectly implemented comparison operators. An attacker could use this issue to cause applications using SQLite to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. This issue only affected Ubuntu 15.04. (CVE-2015-3415)

CVE-2015-3416.title: USN-2698-1: SQLite vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-3416.body: Michal Zalewski discovered that SQLite incorrectly handle printf precision and width values during floating-point conversions. An attacker could use this issue to cause applications using SQLite to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-3416)

CVE-2015-3456.title: USN-2608-1: QEMU vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-3456.body: Jason Geffner discovered that QEMU incorrectly handled the virtual floppy driver. This issue is known as VENOM. A malicious guest could use this issue to cause a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code on the host as the user running the QEMU process. In the default installation, when QEMU is used with libvirt, attackers would be isolated by the libvirt AppArmor profile. (CVE-2015-3456)

CVE-2015-3622.body: Hanno Böck discovered that Libtasn1 incorrectly handled certain ASN.1 data. A remote attacker could possibly exploit this with specially crafted ASN.1 data and cause applications using Libtasn1 to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

CVE-2015-4004.title: USN-2989-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-4004.body: Jason A. Donenfeld discovered multiple out-of-bounds reads in the OZMO USB over wifi device drivers in the Linux kernel. A remote attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or obtain potentially sensitive information from kernel memory. (CVE-2015-4004)

CVE-2015-4036.title: USN-2634-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-4036.body: A memory corruption flaw was discovered in the Linux kernel's scsi subsystem. A local attacker could potentially exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2015-4036)

CVE-2015-4036.title: USN-2633-1: Linux kernel (Trusty HWE) vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-4036.body: A memory corruption flaw was discovered in the Linux kernel's scsi subsystem. A local attacker could potentially exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2015-4036)

CVE-2015-4047.title: USN-2623-1: ipsec-tools vulnerability
CVE-2015-4047.body: It was discovered that racoon, the ipsec-tools IKE daemon, incorrectly handled certain UDP packets. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause racoon to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

CVE-2015-4103.title: USN-2630-1: QEMU vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-4103.body: Jan Beulich discovered that the QEMU Xen code incorrectly restricted write access to the host MSI message data field. A malicious guest could use this issue to cause a denial of service. This issue only applied to Ubuntu 14.04 LTS, Ubuntu 14.10 and Ubuntu 15.04. (CVE-2015-4103)

CVE-2015-4104.title: USN-2630-1: QEMU vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-4104.body: Jan Beulich discovered that the QEMU Xen code incorrectly restricted access to the PCI MSI mask bits. A malicious guest could use this issue to cause a denial of service. This issue only applied to Ubuntu 14.04 LTS, Ubuntu 14.10 and Ubuntu 15.04. (CVE-2015-4104)

CVE-2015-4105.title: USN-2630-1: QEMU vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-4105.body: Jan Beulich discovered that the QEMU Xen code incorrectly handled MSI-X error messages. A malicious guest could use this issue to cause a denial of service. This issue only applied to Ubuntu 14.04 LTS, Ubuntu 14.10 and Ubuntu 15.04. (CVE-2015-4105)

CVE-2015-4141.title: USN-2650-1: wpa_supplicant and hostapd vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-4141.body: Kostya Kortchinsky discovered multiple flaws in wpa_supplicant and hostapd. A remote attacker could use these issues to cause wpa_supplicant or hostapd to crash, resulting in a denial of service. CVE-2015-4167.title: USN-2631-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-4167.body: Carl H Lunde discovered missing sanity checks in the Linux kernel's UDF file system (CONFIG_UDF_FS). A local attacker could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (system crash) by using a corrupted file system image. (CVE-2015-4167)

CVE-2015-4171.title: USN-2628-1: strongSwan vulnerability
CVE-2015-4171.body: Alexander E. Patrakov discovered that strongSwan incorrectly handled certain IKEv2 setups. A malicious server could possibly use this issue to obtain user credentials.

CVE-2015-4473.title: USN-2702-2: Ubufox update
CVE-2015-4473.body: Gary Kwong, Christian Holler, Byron Campen, Tyson Smith, Bobby Holley, Chris Coulson, and Eric Rahm discovered multiple memory safety issues in Firefox. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox. (CVE-2015-4473, CVE-2015-4474)

CVE-2015-4551.title: USN-2793-1: LibreOffice vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-4551.body: Federico Scrinzi discovered that LibreOffice incorrectly handled documents inserted into Writer or Calc via links. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted document, a remote attacker could possibly obtain the contents of arbitrary files. (CVE-2015-4551)

CVE-2015-4588.title: USN-2670-1: libwmf vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-4588.body: Fernando Muñoz and Stefan Cornelius discovered that libwmf incorrectly handled certain malformed images. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a crafted image file, an attacker could cause a denial of service or execute arbitrary code with privileges of the user invoking the program.

CVE-2015-4695.title: USN-2670-1: libwmf vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-4695.body: Fernando Muñoz and Stefan Cornelius discovered that libwmf incorrectly handled certain malformed images. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a crafted image file, an attacker could cause a denial of service or execute arbitrary code with privileges of the user invoking the program.

CVE-2015-5143.title: USN-2671-1: Django vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-5143.body: Eric Peterson and Lin Hua Cheng discovered that Django incorrectly handled session records. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2015-5143)

CVE-2015-5144.title: USN-2671-1: Django vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-5144.body: Sjoerd Job Postmus discovered that DJango incorrectly handled newline characters when performing validation. A remote attacker could use this issue to perform header injection attacks. (CVE-2015-5144)

CVE-2015-5156.title: USN-2777-1: Linux kernel (Utopic HWE) vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-5156.body: It was discovered that virtio networking in the Linux kernel did not handle fragments correctly, leading to kernel memory corruption. A remote attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute code with administrative privileges. (CVE-2015-5156)

CVE-2015-5156.title: USN-2774-1: Linux kernel (OMAP4) vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-5156.body: It was discovered that virtio networking in the Linux kernel did not handle fragments correctly, leading to kernel memory corruption. CVE-2015-5156.title: USN-2773-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-5156.body: It was discovered that virtio networking in the Linux kernel did not handle fragments correctly, leading to kernel memory corruption. A remote attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute code with administrative privileges. (CVE-2015-5156)

CVE-2015-5157.title: USN-2691-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-5157.body: Andy Lutomirski and Petr Matousek discovered that an NMI (non-maskable interrupt) that interrupts userspace and encounters an IRET fault is incorrectly handled by the Linux kernel. An unprivileged local user could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service (kernel OOPs), corruption, or potentially escalate privileges on the system. (CVE-2015-5157)

CVE-2015-5174.title: USN-3024-1: Tomcat vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-5174.body: It was discovered that Tomcat incorrectly handled pathnames used by web applications in a getResource, getResourceAsStream, or getResourcePaths call. A remote attacker could use this issue to possibly list a parent directory . This issue only affected Ubuntu 12.04 LTS, Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 15.10. (CVE-2015-5174)

CVE-2015-5180.title: USN-3239-2: GNU C Library Regression
CVE-2015-5180.body: USN-3239-1 fixed vulnerabilities in the GNU C Library. Unfortunately, the fix for CVE-2015-5180 introduced an internal ABI change within the resolver library. This update reverts the change. We apologize for the inconvenience.

CVE-2015-5180.title: USN-3239-1: GNU C Library vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-5180.body: Florian Weimer discovered a NULL pointer dereference in the DNS resolver of the GNU C Library. An attacker could use this to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2015-5180)

CVE-2015-5194.title: USN-2783-1: NTP vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-5194.body: Miroslav Lichvar discovered that NTP incorrectly handled logconfig directives. In a non-default configuration, a remote authenticated attacker could possibly use this issue to cause NTP to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2015-5194)

CVE-2015-5195.title: USN-2783-1: NTP vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-5195.body: Miroslav Lichvar discovered that NTP incorrectly handled certain statistics types. In a non-default configuration, a remote authenticated attacker could possibly use this issue to cause NTP to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2015-5195)

CVE-2015-5198.title: USN-2729-1: libvdpau vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-5198.body: Florian Weimer discovered that libvdpau incorrectly handled certain environment variables. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to gain privileges.

CVE-2015-5199.title: USN-2729-1: libvdpau vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-5199.body: Florian Weimer discovered that libvdpau incorrectly handled certain environment variables. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to gain privileges.

CVE-2015-5212.title: USN-2793-1: LibreOffice vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-5212.body: It was discovered that LibreOffice incorrectly handled PrinterSetup data stored in ODF files. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted ODF document, a remote attacker could cause LibreOffice to crash, and possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-5212)

CVE-2015-5213.title: USN-2793-1: LibreOffice vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-5213.body: It was discovered that LibreOffice incorrectly handled the number of pieces in DOC files. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted DOC document, a remote attacker could cause LibreOffice to crash, and possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-5213)

CVE-2015-5214.title: USN-2793-1: LibreOffice vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-5214.body: It was discovered that LibreOffice incorrectly handled bookmarks in DOC files. If a user were tricked into opening a specially crafted DOC document, a remote attacker could cause LibreOffice to crash, and possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-5214)

CVE-2015-5234.title: USN-2817-1: IcedTea Web vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-5234.body: It was discovered that IcedTea Web incorrectly handled applet URLs. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to inject applets into the .appletTrustSettings configuration file and bypass user approval. (CVE-2015-5234)

CVE-2015-5235.title: USN-2817-1: IcedTea Web vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-5235.body: Andrea Palazzo discovered that IcedTea Web incorrectly determined the origin of unsigned applets. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to bypass user approval, or to trick the user into approving applet execution. (CVE-2015-5235)

CVE-2015-5252.title: USN-2855-2: Samba regression
CVE-2015-5252.body: USN-2855-1 fixed vulnerabilities in Samba. The upstream fix for CVE-2015-5252 introduced a regression in certain specific environments. This update fixes the problem.

CVE-2015-5252.title: USN-2855-1: Samba vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-5252.body: Jan Kasprzak discovered that Samba incorrectly handled certain symlinks. A remote attacker could use this issue to access files outside the exported share path. (CVE-2015-5252)

CVE-2015-5260.title: USN-2766-1: Spice vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-5260.body: Frediano Ziglio discovered multiple buffer overflows, undefined behavior signed integer operations, race conditions, memory leaks, and denial of service issues in Spice. A malicious guest operating system could potentially exploit these issues to escape virtualization. (CVE-2015-5260, CVE-2015-5261)

CVE-2015-5261.title: USN-2766-1: Spice vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-5261.body: Frediano Ziglio discovered multiple buffer overflows, undefined behavior signed integer operations, race conditions, memory leaks, and denial of service issues in Spice. A malicious guest operating system could potentially exploit these issues to escape virtualization. (CVE-2015-5260, CVE-2015-5261)

CVE-2015-5262.title: USN-2769-1: Apache Commons HttpClient vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-5262.body: It was discovered that Apache Commons HttpClient did not properly handle read timeouts during HTTPS handshakes. A remote attacker could trigger this flaw to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2015-5262)

CVE-2015-5277.title: USN-2985-2: GNU C Library regression
CVE-2015-5277.body: Sumit Bose and Lukas Slebodnik discovered that the Name Service Switch (NSS) implementation in the GNU C Library did not handle long lines in the files databases correctly. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-5277)

CVE-2015-5277.title: USN-2985-1: GNU C Library vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-5277.body: Sumit Bose and Lukas Slebodnik discovered that the Name Service Switch (NSS) implementation in the GNU C Library did not handle long lines in the files databases correctly. CVE-2015-6759.title: USN-2770-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-6759.body: It was discovered that Blink did not ensure that the origin of LocalStorage resources are considered unique. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2015-6759)

CVE-2015-6768.title: USN-2825-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-6768.body: Several security issues were discovered in the DOM implementation in Chromium. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit these to bypass same origin restrictions. (CVE-2015-6768, CVE-2015-6770)

CVE-2015-6769.title: USN-2825-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-6769.body: A security issue was discovered in the provisional-load commit implementation in Chromium. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to bypass same origin restrictions. (CVE-2015-6769)

CVE-2015-6770.title: USN-2825-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-6770.body: Several security issues were discovered in the DOM implementation in Chromium. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit these to bypass same origin restrictions. (CVE-2015-6768, CVE-2015-6770)

CVE-2015-6771.title: USN-2825-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-6771.body: An out-of-bounds read was discovered in the array map and filter operations in V8 in some circumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via renderer crash. (CVE-2015-6771)

CVE-2015-6772.title: USN-2825-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-6772.body: It was discovered that the DOM implementation in Chromium does not prevent javascript: URL navigation while a document is being detached. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to bypass same origin restrictions. (CVE-2015-6772)

CVE-2015-6773.title: USN-2825-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-6773.body: An out-of bounds read was discovered in Skia in some cirumstances. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to cause a denial of service via renderer crash. (CVE-2015-6773)

CVE-2015-6782.title: USN-2825-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-6782.body: It was discovered that the Document::open function in Chromium did not ensure that page-dismissal event handling is compatible with modal dialog blocking. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to spoof application UI content. (CVE-2015-6782)

CVE-2015-6784.title: USN-2825-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-6784.body: It was discovered that the page serializer in Chromium mishandled MOTW comments for URLs in some circumstances. An attacker could potentially exploit this to inject HTML content. (CVE-2015-6784)

CVE-2015-6785.title: USN-2825-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-6785.body: It was discovered that the Content Security Policy (CSP) implementation in Chromium accepted an x.y hostname as a match for a *.x.y pattern. An attacker could potentially exploit this to bypass intended access restrictions. (CVE-2015-6785)

CVE-2015-6786.title: USN-2825-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-6786.body: Multiple use-after-free bugs were discovered in the application cache implementation in Chromium. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit these to cause a denial of service via application crash, or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking the program. CVE-2015-6790.title: USN-2860-1: Oxide vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-6790.body: An issue was discovered with the page serializer in Blink. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could potentially exploit this to inject arbitrary script or HTML. (CVE-2015-6790)

CVE-2015-6820.title: USN-2944-1: Libav vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-6820.body: It was discovered that Libav incorrectly handled certain malformed media files. If a user were tricked into opening a crafted media file, an attacker could cause a denial of service via application crash, or possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user invoking the program.

CVE-2015-6908.title: USN-2742-1: OpenLDAP vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-6908.body: Denis Andzakovic discovered that OpenLDAP incorrectly handled certain BER data. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause OpenLDAP to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2015-6908)

CVE-2015-7181.body: Tyson Smith and David Keeler discovered that NSS incorrectly handled decoding certain ASN.1 data. An remote attacker could use this issue to cause NSS to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

CVE-2015-7195.body: Frans Rosén discovered that certain escaped characters in the Location header are parsed incorrectly, resulting in a navigation to the previously parsed version of a URL. CVE-2015-7197.title: USN-2785-1: Firefox vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-7197.body: Ehsan Akhgari discovered a mechanism for a web worker to bypass secure requirements for web sockets. If a user were tricked in to opening a specially crafted website, an attacker could exploit this to bypass the mixed content web socket policy. (CVE-2015-7197)

CVE-2015-7540.title: USN-2855-2: Samba regression
CVE-2015-7540.body: It was discovered that the Samba LDAP server incorrectly handled certain packets. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause the LDAP server to stop responding, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS, Ubuntu 15.04 and Ubuntu 15.10. (CVE-2015-7540)

CVE-2015-7545.body: Blake Burkhart discovered that the Git git-remote-ext helper incorrectly handled recursive clones of git repositories. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code by injecting commands via crafted URLs.

CVE-2015-7547.body: It was discovered that the GNU C Library incorrectly handled receiving responses while performing DNS resolution. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause the GNU C Library to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

CVE-2015-7552.title: USN-3085-1: GDK-PixBuf vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-7552.body: It was discovered that the GDK-PixBuf library did not properly handle specially crafted bmp images, leading to a heap-based buffer overflow. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted bmp file, a remote attacker could use this flaw to cause GDK-PixBuf to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. This issue only affected Ubuntu 12.04 LTS and Ubuntu 14.04 LTS. (CVE-2015-7552)

(CVE-2015-7673)

CVE-2015-8607.body: David Golden discovered that the canonpath function in the Perl File::Spec module did not properly preserve the taint attribute. An attacker could possibly use this issue to bypass the taint protection mechanism.

CVE-2015-8768.body: It was discovered that click did not properly perform input sanitization during click package installation. CVE-2015-8776.title: USN-2985-2: GNU C Library regression
CVE-2015-8776.body: Adam Nielsen discovered that the strftime function in the GNU C Library did not properly handle out-of-range argument data. An attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly expose sensitive information. (CVE-2015-8776)

CVE-2015-8865.title: USN-2952-1: PHP vulnerabilities
CVE-2015-8865.body: It was discovered that the PHP Zip extension incorrectly handled directories when processing certain zip files. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to create arbitrary directories. (CVE-2014-9767) It was discovered that the PHP Soap client incorrectly validated data types. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2015-8835, CVE-2016-3185) It was discovered that the PHP MySQL native driver incorrectly handled TLS connections to MySQL databases. A man in the middle attacker could possibly use this issue to downgrade and snoop on TLS connections. This vulnerability is known as BACKRONYM. (CVE-2015-8838) It was discovered that PHP incorrectly handled the imagerotate function. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly obtain sensitive information. This issue only applied to Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 15.10. (CVE-2016-1903) Hans Jerry Illikainen discovered that the PHP phar extension incorrectly handled certain tar archives. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2016-2554) It was discovered that the PHP WDDX extension incorrectly handled certain malformed XML data. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2016-3141) It was discovered that the PHP phar extension incorrectly handled certain zip files. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2016-3142) It was discovered that the PHP libxml_disable_entity_loader() setting was shared between threads. When running under PHP-FPM, this could result in XML external entity injection and entity expansion issues. This issue only applied to Ubuntu 12.04 LTS and Ubuntu 14.04 LTS. (No CVE number) It was discovered that the PHP openssl_random_pseudo_bytes() function did not return cryptographically strong pseudo-random bytes. (No CVE number) It was discovered that the PHP Fileinfo component incorrectly handled certain magic files. An attacker could use this issue to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE number pending) It was discovered that the PHP php_snmp_error() function incorrectly handled string formatting. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. This issue only applied to Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 15.10. (CVE number pending) It was discovered that the PHP rawurlencode() function incorrectly handled large strings. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE number pending) It was discovered that the PHP phar extension incorrectly handled certain filenames in archives. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE number pending) It was discovered that the PHP mb_strcut() function incorrectly handled string formatting. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE number pending)
